info.name: GAIA API (v1.7 - JA)
info.description:
GAIA API gives a new way to read information and to send commands to the Check Point servers. Just like it is possible to manage any checkpoint device, it is now possible to do the same using command line tools and through web-services.

Target audience, GAIA API was created for the following audiences, System administrators who wish to improve their productivity by scripting some of their daily tasks, Customers who wish to integrate the Check Point solution with other solutions that they have (virtualization servers, ticketing systems, change management systems, etc.) and ever Check Point partners and integrators that look for an easy to use API that can help them create complementary products around the Check Point solution.

request.description: Log in to the server with username and password. The server shows your session unique identifier. Enter this session unique identifier in the 'X-chkp-sid' header of each request
Keep the session valid/alive (Increasing session by 600 seconds)
Log out from the current session. After logging out the session id is not valid any more
Set configurations for a pbr rule

item.name: set pbr table
response: {"table": "mytable", "message": "PBR Table mytable updated and now has 2 static-routes configured, use show-pbr-table to view configurations"}

item.name: set pbr table static next hop priority

request.description: Setting the priority of a PBR table static route nexthop gateway

response: {"table": "mytable", "message": "PBR Table mytable updated, use show-pbr-table to view configurations"}

request.description: Show the configuration of a PBR rule

item.name: show pbr rules

request.description: Show the configuration of all PBR Rules

response: {"objects": [{"priority": 5, "match": {"interface": "eth1", "port": 10, "protocol": "tcp", "destination": {"address": "3.3.3.3", "mask-length": 32}, "source": {"address": "1.1.1.1", "mask-length": 32}}, "action": {"table": "mytable", "main-table": false, "prohibit": false, "unreachable": false}}, {"priority": 3, "match": {"destination": {"address": "3.3.3.3", "mask-length": 32}, "source": {"address": "1.1.1.1", "mask-length": 32}}, "action": {"main-table": true, "prohibit": false, "unreachable": false}}], "from": 1, "to": 2, "total": 2}

request.description: Show the configuration of a PBR table
Show the configuration of all PBR Tables
Set configurations for a new or existing static route

item.name: set static route next hop priority

request.description: Setting the priority of a static route nexthop gateway
Show the configuration of a static route
Show the configuration of all static routes
Enables/Disables IPv6 support in the machine's operating system
Check IPv6 support in the machine's operating system
Show the contents of the IS-IS database, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show the IS-IS errors, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show the IS-IS system-id to hostname mapping database, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show the running state for a specific IS-IS interface, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show the running state for all IS-IS interfaces, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show the running state for a specific IS-IS neighbor, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+

item.name: show isis neighbors

request.description: Show the running state for all IS-IS neighbors, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+

response: {"from": 1, "objects": [{"area-list": ["49.0000"], "circuit-id": "GW123.06", "hold-time": 10, "interface": "eth1.102", "ipv4-address": "10.1.102.123", "ipv6-address": "fe80::250:56ff:fead:e7ea", "is-dis": true, "last-state-change": 1619644051, "level": "level-1-2", "mac-address": "0:50:56:ad:e7:ea", "mtid-list": ["IPv4", "IPv6"], "priority": 64, "restart-capable": true, "restarting-now": false, "state": "up", "system-id": "GW123"}, {"area-list": ["49.0002"], "circuit-id": "GW124.08", "hold-time": 30, "interface": "eth1.101", "ipv4-address": "10.1.101.111", "ipv6-address": "fe80::250:56ff:fead:226", "is-dis": false, "last-state-change": 1619644051, "level": "level-1-2", "mac-address": "0:50:56:ad:2:26", "mtid-list": ["IPv4", "IPv6"], "priority": 64, "restart-capable": true, "restarting-now": false, "state": "up", "system-id": "GW111_ICARUS1"}, {"area-list": ["49.0000", "49.0003"], "bfd-sessions-list": [{"state": "up", "topology": "IPv4"}, {"state": "up", "topology": "IPv6"}], "bfd-support-list": ["IPv4", "IPv6"], "circuit-id": "6", "hold-time": 30, "interface": "eth1.103", "ipv4-address": "10.1.103.121", "ipv6-address": "fe80::250:56ff:fead:67e4", "is-dis": false, "last-state-change": 1619644051, "level": "level-1-2", "mac-address": "0:50:56:ad:67:e4", "mtid-list": ["IPv4", "IPv6"], "priority": "point-to-point", "restart-capable": true, "restarting-now": false, "state": "up", "system-id": "GW121"}], "to": 3, "total": 3}

request.description: Show the inbound and outbound packet counters for the different types of IS-IS PDUs, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+

Show OSPFv2 routemaps, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show OSPFv2 summary, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show bootp running stats, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+
Show bootp interface running state, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+

item.name: show bootp interfaces

request.description: Show current state of all running bootp interfaces, request only supported on GAIA versions R81.20+

response: {"objects": [{"gateway-address": "10.10.10.101", "max-hopcount": 4, "name": "eth1", "primary": "automatic", "relay-to": [{"address": "20.20.20.102", "status": "ok"}, {"address": "30.30.30.103", "status": "ok"}], "option-82-enabled": true, "circuit-id": "eth1", "remote-id": "myhost", "status": "the relay agent is active (13)", "wait-time": 0}, {"max-hopcount": 4, "name": "eth2", "primary": "automatic", "relay-to": [], "option-82-enabled": false, "circuit-id": "disabled", "remote-id": "disabled", "status": "the relay agent is not configured to run on this interface (0)", "wait-time": 0}], "from": 1, "to": 2, "total": 2}

request.description: Show the NTP state, servers (primary and secondary) and the current NTP server
Sets time, date, and timezone. Note: time and date cannot be changed while NTP is active.
